definition[0]: (1974-) a British comedy actor who is best known for appearing with David Walliams in the television sketch show Little Britain. He plays characters in the show such as Daffyd Thomas (a gay Welsh man), Vicky Pollard (a badly behaved teenage girl), Andy Pipkin (a man in a wheelchair), and Marjorie Dawes (a diet instructor). He first became famous playing the character of George Dawes, a large baby who played the drums and kept the score on Shooting Stars, a comedy television game show with Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer. He is known for being bald and for being openly gay.
